New Records: Shohei Ohtani tied for third on the Dodgers' single-season homer list with 47 home runs
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a two-run single in the bottom of the third inning to give the Dodgers a 7-3 lead
Tommy Edman hit his second home run of the game in the eighth inning
Gavin Lux got a tiebreaking hit from the Dodgers in the seventh inning
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers (87-59) remained five games up on the second-place Arizona Diamondbacks in the National League West
Los Angeles moved 5 1/2 games up on the third-place San Diego Padres
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani has 47 home runs to go along with 48 steals as he closes in on the first 50-50 season in major league history
The Cubs (75-71) fell five games behind the New York Mets in the chase for the final NL wild-card spot
Others: Isaac Paredes hit an RBI single and former Dodger Michael Busch followed with a run-scoring double for the Cubs in the top of the first inning
Seiya Suzuki and Cody Bellinger hit home runs for the Cubs
